content: smaller sized needles k to the end of the heel pick up and k 1 st in each slip_stitch down to the held sts on the st holder k held sts pick up and k 1 st in each slip_stitch back up to the heel k the heel back to the beginning of the round pick up ribbing begins at 37 53 1 * k1 p1 ** repeat from * to ** to the end if the st count isn t even you will have 1 st left over at the end if that is the case work the last st as p2tog to make the st count even establish ribbing begins at minute mark 43 41 2 - 3 * k1 p1 ** repeat from * to ** to the end 4 * k1 p1 ** repeat from * to ** 5 times until you are 12 sts past the m w&t ribbing short row begins at minute mark 46 42 5 * k1 p1 ** repeat from * to ** 11 times until you are 12 sts past the m w&t 6 * k1 p1 ** repeat from * to ** 9 times until you are 8 sts past the m w&t 7 * k1 p1 ** repeat from * to ** 7 times until you are 8 sts past the m w&t 8 * k1 p1 ** repeat from * to ** to the m 9 resume established k1 p1 ribbing in the round picking up and 2-color note break body-color yarn working the wraps together with the stitches as you come to them after round 9 join toe-color yarn and pick up wraps begins at minute mark 50 00 use for remainder of the pattern - continue to work in k1 p1 ribbing until the ribbing measures 5 /1 5 cm at the center of the toe - bobble in ribbing using a standard bobble bind off begins at minute mark 54 36 finishing and terms of use soak the socks in tepid water and lay flat to dry i like to block these socks about 25 / 5 cm less than the actual foot length this will help them stay on your feet after they are dry weave in all the ends please note that this pattern and photos herein are copyrighted by sheila toy stromberg do not sell this pattern clothing made by following it in part or whole or distribute without permission giving items made by following this pattern as gifts is fine donating it if money doesn t change hands is also fine if you have any 4 questions would like permission to auction an item made by following the pattern for charity or would like a cottage license feel free to email me at sheila toy@hotmail com 5
